Title: Do Not Fix Bugs Reported in Your Open Source Projects
Description: Have you watched The IT Crowd? It’s a hilarious British television sitcom from around 2006 that cast a bunch of IT geniuses at the Reynholm Industries tech support department in London. One of the signature laughs is that every time the phone rang, Roy would pick it up and without waiting say “Have you turned it off and on again?”, then hang up. I often feel like Roy when engaging with users reporting bugs in open-source projects I maintain.

Title: The Hardest Thing: Building and Running the UNIX Kernel from Original Sources
Description: Dave takes you on an adventure where he builds and deploys the 2.11 BSD Kernel on a PDP-11/83.

Title: Dec 22: Why we use our own hardware at Fastmail
Description: Why we use our own hardware and what the tradeoffs and costs look like

Description: Loneliness is at least 4-dimensional.

Title: Propositional Logic
Description: Propositional logic is the study of the inferential relationships among sentences. It focuses on the role of propositional connectives.

Title: Feeling seen - Byte Tank
Description: Celebration of external validation, and possible countermeasures

Title: BSA’s new member model creates embarrassing membership loss
Description: Scouting America (nee Boy Scouts of America) will likely have a large 2024 youth-membership loss. It's likely due to its new rolling-membership scheme. By December 31, 2024, BSA SA will likely have a 2.4% member loss. If nothing changes, it will reach 14% by April 2025! SA could have avoided this with a subscription model....

Title: Carpalx - keyboard layout optimizer
Description: Three fully optimized layouts are presented here. Each provides an optimial typing experience with a slightly different letter mask. Use of the pinky is reduced and hand alternation is increased over popular alternatives like Colemak.

Title: Building Custom RSS Feeds for LWN.net
Description: If you’ve spent a bit of time in the Linux community, especially anything kernel-related, you may be familiar with Linux Weekly News. It’s an invaluable resource for kernel development news, security updates, and general open source coverage. While they offer RSS for syndication, I found myself wanting more control over the feeds themselves - specifically, the ability to filter out subscriber-only articles.

Title: The day I canceled my Spotify subscription
Description: I used to be a big fan of Spotify. Today I cancelled my subscription.

Title: The 80-hour app
Description: Building an app in 80 hours to keep up with your DIY projects

Title: Artificial General Software
Description: The personal website of Mark Fayngersh

Title: Lonely Weekends
Description: A personal account of experiencing weekend loneliness during PhD studies, exploring how friend dynamics change with relationships, and discovering that committed relationships with family and partners are crucial for overcoming isolation and achieving success.

Title: The Cherry Pick Ratio
Description: Generative AI's 'Cherry Pick Ratio' measures how many outputs a user must generate to find a useful result, impacting user tolerance and adoption.
